item.title: [CASSANDRA-1382] Race condition leads to FileNotFoundException on startup
item.description:
On startup LocationInfo file is deleted then attempted to be read from.

Steps to reproduce: Kill then quickly restart

item.summary: Race condition leads to FileNotFoundException on startup

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: When there are compacted files to delete, initializing the system table tries to delete its statistics, which results in trying to initialize the system table. The statistics deletion needs to happen outside of the CFS initialization.

Another approach to this fix would have been us have an initialization stage and make sure that CFS creation and statistics clean up happen on it. The stats cleanup would be submitted at the end of the stage while a CFS was being initialized.
it looks like this patch says we only delete statistics for sstables that had .compacted files left hanging around on the next restart, which won't be the case if they got cleaned up by the GC hook

It was the same way before. SSTable.deleteIfCompacted() is the only method that calls StatisticsTable.deleteSSTableStatistics(). The only place SST.deleteIfCompacted() gets called is from the CFS constructor which is called during init.

Integrated in Cassandra #517 (See https://hudson.apache.org/hudson/job/Cassandra/517/)

separate CFS dir cleanup from CFS instantiation. fixes race condition. patch by gdusbabek, reviewed by jbellis. CASSANDRA-1382
